title: Donetsk
summary: Donetsk (UK: /dɒˈnjɛtsk/ don-YETSK,[1] US: /dəˈn(j)ɛtsk/ də-N(Y)ETSK;[2][3] Ukrainian: Донецьк, romanized: Donećk [doˈnɛtsʲk] (listen), Russian: Донецк [dɐˈnʲetsk]), formerly known as Aleksandrovka, Yuzivka (or Hughesovka), Stalin and Stalino (see also: cities' alternative names), is an industrial city in eastern Ukraine located on the Kalmius River in the disputed area of Donetsk Oblast. While internationally recognized as in Ukraine, the city is under the de facto administration of the unrecognized Donetsk People's Republic, which claims it as its capital city. The population was estimated at 905,364 (2021 est.)[4] in the city core, with over 2 million in the metropolitan area (2011). According to the 2001 Ukrainian Census, Donetsk was the fifth-largest city in Ukraine.[5]
